text:
The Ant Manual does not document the exit codes for the Ant program.

For calling ant from within a shell script, it would be helpful
to be guaranteed that, say, an exit code greater than zero means
that the Ant script had failed.
creator: rovf@operamail.com

text:
I suppose we should, although historically ant.bat has not returned an exit
code, for win9x compatiblity reasons.

Feel free to submit a patch to the docs.
creator: stevel@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Actually I should note that ant.bat doesnt use exit codes with an 
> exit 1
> line because then whatever shell you run in disappears. 

I use /B arg to exit. This prevents shell from disappearing. I know this works
for XP  and window server 2003. Here is the help 
EXIT

Quits the CMD.EXE program (command interpreter) or the current batch
script.

EXIT [/B] [exitCode]

  /B          specifies to exit the current batch script instead of
              CMD.EXE.  If executed from outside a batch script, it
              will quit CMD.EXE

  exitCode    specifies a numeric number.  if /B is specified, sets
              ERRORLEVEL that number.  If quitting CMD.EXE, sets the process
              exit code with that number.

Exit value can be overwritten by custom classes. Added a documentation to the
running.html.
creator: jan@materne.de
